sourcing.instructions: Nb: Obtain from metal suppliers or online retailers specializing in rare metals. Ni: Available at hardware stores or welding supply shops. P: Source from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. V: Acquire from specialized metal suppliers or recycling centers.

1. Weigh out 120 g of Niobium (Nb), 30 g of Nickel (Ni), 90 g of Phosphorus (P), and 120 g of Vanadium (V) using a precise digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine the Nb, Ni, P, and V powders in a ceramic or glass mixing container. 3. Use a stainless steel spatula to mix the powders thoroughly until a consistent blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure uniformity. 5. After milling, collect the powder and ensure it is free from lumps.

steps: 1. Place the blended powder into a graphite crucible. 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C (2192°F). 3. Once the temperature is reached, insert the crucible and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to facilitate proper sintering of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the blended powder into a graphite crucible. 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C (2192°F). 3. Once the temperature is reached, insert the crucible and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to facilitate proper sintering of the materials.

steps: 1. After the sintering process, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C or 77°F). 2. This cooling process should take about 8-10 hours to avoid thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the sintering process, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C or 77°F). 2. This cooling process should take about 8-10 hours to avoid thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the sintered sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect the sample for any surface irregularities. 3. Use a diamond grinding wheel to smooth out any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Clean the surface with isopropyl alcohol to remove any dust or residues. 5. Optionally, apply a thin coat of protective sealant to enhance durability.
